scratch, p=
robably I made some mistake. Forget it. 

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "pet=
ar_chervenski" 
<petar_chervenski@...> wrote:
>
> Consider this as a bug re=
port, the Redo button switches off 
> the "Color" checkbox. 
> 
> --- In ne=
at@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@> wrote:
> >
> > We've been=
 working for a long time on adding color to Picbreeder
> > (http://picbreed=
er.org).  As some of you know from experience,
> > evolving black and white=
 pictures with CPPN-like representations 
is
> > fairly straightforward, bu=
t adding color is a major challenge.  
> Thanks
> > in large part to Nick B=
eato, who did the actual implementation on 
> the
> > applet after many gro=
up discussions, we now have an intuitive and 
> fun
> > color evolution sys=
tem that actually works.  An important aspect 
of
> > our color system for =
the continuity of the site is that it allows 
> you
> > begin with one of t=
he preexisting black and white images (if you 
> want)
> > and it will evol=
ve color into it seamlessly.  So all the existing
> > images can now be col=
orized!
> > 
> > We've just begun to start publishing some color images, wh=
ich you 
> can
> > see under our Newest Images category:
> > 
> > http://pi=
cbreeder.org/imagedisplay.php?type=3DCREATED&page=3D0
> > 
> > By the way, =
in case you did not know, Picbreeder also allows 
> anonymous
> > publishin=
g, so you don't need an account to play with and even

> > color =
pictures.
